content.description: One of the few sport routes at Naples. A fun, open-handed set of moves thru the early on crux leads up a series of cool features on the far left side of the crag.
content.location: Far Left end of main wall

content.description: The line that follows a moderate corner and finger crack on the right side of a left-facing corner until mid-route where it transitions into a thin seam for the  last 30 feet to the anchors. Thin gear and technical climbing make this an excellent route.
content.location: Center of main wall. The start follows an obvious finger crack of the right face of a left-facing corner.

content.description: Fun route with a steep crack start. The route follows an overhanging crack to a horizontal then a fun off-fingers and hands crack to the anchors.
content.location: Near the left end of the main wall

content.description: Thanks to the father/son team for cleaning up such a fun climb! Much scrubbing and block chucking later....truly a quality bouldery route. This was first led directly over the 1st bolt which certainly adds another 5.10 sequence. The crux moves off the ledge getting situated in the dihedral will test your finger strength and flexibility.
content.location: The small dihedral 10 feet left of monkeys on crack, and 20 feet right of cheeky monkeys.

content.description: This is an area classic and likely the first route climbed here. Short, yet surprisingly fun, this fist splitter is a great way to warm in to the area.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5" with anchors on top
content.location: Look for obvious splitter on right end of main wall

content.description: Extremely short, but also quite fun. This route is a great way to practice insecure finger locking and crack technique.
content.protection: TCUs and nuts. Has been bouldered/free soloed and led, but is commonly top-roped from easy walk-around on left. Two bolts on top.
content.location: on small wall around the far North end of crag

content.description: Fun, hidden splitter with bouldery start. More challenging than it looks.
content.protection: Gear to 2" with anchors on top.
